intro: Pedicularis deqinensis, commonly known as the Deqin lousewort, is a flowering plant native to the Yunnan province in China. It belongs to the family Orobanchaceae, commonly known as the broomrape family, and is characterized by its parasitic nature, relying on host plants for nutrients. The plant produces striking, spurred flowers that are typically pink or purple in color, which attract pollinators such as bees and butterflies. It thrives in alpine meadows and rocky habitats at high altitudes, showcasing its adaptability to harsh environments. Due to its limited distribution and specific ecological requirements, it is considered a rare and endangered species.
